title: Retry backup uploads in onedrive
body:
<!--
  You are amazing! Thanks for contributing to our project!
  Please, DO NOT DELETE ANY TEXT from this template! (unless instructed).
-->
## Breaking change
<!--

  write it towards our users, not us.

<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the
  maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug
  or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue in the
  additional information section.
-->

title: VOIP - handle ongoing calls for announce and start conversation
body:
Allow announcements and conversation starts to be queued up for an existing call. Also allow specifying a SIP username for the HA endpoint which is required for some VOIP servers.

I tried to combine elements from the current implementation and my original implementation to handle announcements and conversation start when there is already a call to the specified satellite.

title: Fetch all programs instead of only the available ones at Home Connect
body:
<!--
  You are amazing! Thanks for contributing to our project!
  Please, DO NOT DELETE ANY TEXT from this template! (unless instructed).
-->
## Proposed change
<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the
  maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug
  or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue in the
  additional information section.
-->

Currently we fetch the available programs, which, if the integration is reloaded while running, the entities that use that data only have the current running program. 

Using the endpoint that fetch all the programs will overcome this issue

title: Energy distance units
body:
<!--
  You are amazing! Thanks for contributing to our project!
  Please, DO NOT DELETE ANY TEXT from this template! (unless instructed).
-->

## Proposed change
<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the
  maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug
  or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue in the
  additional information section.
-->

Add an energy_distance sensor device class with support for unit conversion between metric and US customary energy consumption units by distance, including their inverses (Europe normally uses energy per distance whereas US/UK uses distance per energy). The following units should be supported:

- kWh/100km
- mi/kWh
- km/kWh

Discussed in https://github.com/home-assistant/architecture/discussions/1163

title: Fix KeyError for Shelly virtual number component
body:
<!--
  You are amazing! Thanks for contributing to our project!
  Please, DO NOT DELETE ANY TEXT from this template! (unless instructed).
-->
## Breaking change
<!--
  If your PR contains a breaking change for existing users, it is important
  to tell them what breaks, how to make it work again and why we did this.
  This piece of text is published with the release notes, so it helps if you
  write it towards our users, not us.
  Note: Remove this section if this PR is NOT a breaking change.
-->


## Proposed change
<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the
  maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug
  or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue in the
  additional information section.
-->
Powered by Shelly devices may create a virtual `number` component without a `step` value which results in a `KeyError`.

```
2025-01-30 17:06:36.829 ERROR (MainThread) [homeassistant.components.number] Error while setting up shelly platform for number: 'step'
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/maciek/develop/home-assistant-core/homeassistant/helpers/entity_platform.py", line 366, in _async_setup_platform
    await asyncio.shield(awaitable)
  File "/home/maciek/develop/home-assistant-core/homeassistant/components/shelly/number.py", line 230, in async_setup_entry
    async_setup_entry_rpc(
    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~^
        hass, config_entry, async_add_entities, RPC_NUMBERS, RpcNumber
        ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
    )
    ^
  File "/home/maciek/develop/home-assistant-core/homeassistant/components/shelly/entity.py", line 148, in async_setup_entry_rpc
    async_setup_rpc_attribute_entities(

title: Shorten the integration name for `incomfort`
body:
<!--
  You are amazing! Thanks for contributing to our project!
  Please, DO NOT DELETE ANY TEXT from this template! (unless instructed).

## Proposed change
<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the
  maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug
  or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue in the
  additional information section.
-->
Then curent name for the `incomfort` integration ("Intergas InComfort/Intouch Lan2RF gateway") is quite long and for no good reason. The device set up is a gateway called `Intergas gateway`. That should be enough. To be consequent the translation strings are updated consequently. Also the documentation will be updates.

title: Fix Sonos importing deprecating constant
body:
<!--
  You are amazing! Thanks for contributing to our project!

-->
## Proposed change
<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the

```
Logger: homeassistant.components.ssdp
Source: helpers/deprecation.py:236
integration: Simple Service Discovery Protocol (SSDP) (documentation, issues)
First occurred: 15:14:27 (28 occurrences)
Last logged: 15:53:34

ATTR_UPNP_UDN was used from sonos, this is a deprecated constant which will be removed in HA Core 2026.2. Use homeassistant.helpers.service_info.ssdp.ATTR_UPNP_UDN instead
ATTR_UPNP_MODEL_NAME was used from sonos, this is a deprecated constant which will be removed in HA Core 2026.2. Use homeassistant.helpers.service_info.ssdp.ATTR_UPNP_MODEL_NAME instead

title: Convert valve position to int for Shelly BLU TRV
body:
<!--
  You are amazing! Thanks for contributing to our project!
  Please, DO NOT DELETE ANY TEXT from this template! (unless instructed).
-->
## Breaking change
<!--
  If your PR contains a breaking change for existing users, it is important
  to tell them what breaks, how to make it work again and why we did this.

  Note: Remove this section if this PR is NOT a breaking change.
-->


## Proposed change
<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the
  maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug
  or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue in the
  additional information section.
-->
Fixes:
```
2025-01-30 11:19:13.472 DEBUG (MainThread) [aioshelly.rpc_device.wsrpc] send(172.168.0.142:80): {'id': 13, 'method': 'BluTRV.Call', 'src': 'aios-139868016208320', 'params': {'id': 200, 'method': 'Trv.SetPosition', 'params': {'id': 0, 'pos': 0.0}}, 'dst': 'shellyblugwg3-xxxxxxxxxxxx'}
2025-01-30 11:19:25.052 DEBUG (MainThread) [aioshelly.rpc_device.wsrpc] result(172.168.0.142:80): BluTRV.Call({'id': 200, 'method': 'Trv.SetPosition', 'params': {'id': 0, 'pos': 0.0}}) -> {'code': -103, 'message': 'Argument `pos` is invalid'}
```
This change probably appeared in the latest firmware, I'm pretty sure that previously the device accepted a float value.

title: Fix handling of renamed backup files in the core writer
body:
<!--
  You are amazing! Thanks for contributing to our project!
  Please, DO NOT DELETE ANY TEXT from this template! (unless instructed).
-->
## Proposed change
<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the
  maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug
  or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue in the

Fix handling of renamed backup files in the core writer

title: Include the redirect_url in the Google Drive instructions
body:
<!--
  You are amazing! Thanks for contributing to our project!
  Please, DO NOT DELETE ANY TEXT from this template! (unless instructed).
-->
## Breaking change
<!--
  If your PR contains a breaking change for existing users, it is important
  to tell them what breaks, how to make it work again and why we did this.
  This piece of text is published with the release notes, so it helps if you
  write it towards our users, not us.
  Note: Remove this section if this PR is NOT a breaking change.
-->


## Proposed change
<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the
  maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug
  or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue in the
  additional information section.
-->
Include the redirect_url similar to what Nest does at https://github.com/home-assistant/core/blob/a8175b785f1445319cec7edae411a78272d51707/homeassistant/components/nest/application_credentials.py#L25 and https://github.com/home-assistant/core/blob/a8175b785f1445319cec7edae411a78272d51707/homeassistant/components/nest/strings.json#L3
myuplink also does the same, see https://github.com/home-assistant/core/blob/a8175b785f1445319cec7edae411a78272d51707/homeassistant/components/myuplink/application_credentials.py#L22

The only difference is that I imported the constant directly from config_entry_oauth2_flow. Ideally we would use https://github.com/home-assistant/core/blob/64b056fbe998cf7231906c26f4daab02bb4124a5/homeassistant/helpers/config_entry_oauth2_flow.py#L145 so that this also works for users with my disabled but it doesn't seem feasible. Let me know if you can think of a way using that. I'm afraid this would be a more involved change that would be better done in a separate PR. I'd like to merge this before the 2025.2 release because I've received feedback from 3 different people about the confusion what redirect URL to use.

title: Ignore dangling symlinks when restoring backup
body:
<!--
  You are amazing! Thanks for contributing to our project!
  Please, DO NOT DELETE ANY TEXT from this template! (unless instructed).
-->
## Proposed change
<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the
  maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug
  or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue in the
  additional information section.
-->
Ignore dangling symlinks when restoring backup, we should not fail the restore process because of this.

As an alternative, we could capture the error and log a warning message instead so the user can clean up the symlink

title: Poll supervisor job state when creating or restoring a backup
body:
<!--
  You are amazing! Thanks for contributing to our project!
  Please, DO NOT DELETE ANY TEXT from this template! (unless instructed).
-->
## Proposed change
<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the
  maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug
  or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue in the
  additional information section.
-->
Poll supervisor job state when creating or restoring a backup

Without this, we would wait forever for backup or restore to finish if the backup job already completed once we subscribed to job events.

title: Suppress color_temp warning if color_temp_kelvin is provided
body:

As there seem to be a lot of existing components that send both `color_temp` and `color_temp_kelvin`, this fix suppresses the warning about using `color_temp` if `color_temp_kelvin` is also provided in the same service call.

title: Bump ZHA to 0.0.47
body:
## Proposed change

This bumps ZHA to [0.0.47](https://github.com/zigpy/zha/releases/tag/0.0.47) (full diff: https://github.com/zigpy/zha/compare/0.0.46...0.0.47). These dependency upgrades are bundled with it: 

- `zigpy` [0.76.1](https://github.com/zigpy/zigpy/releases/tag/0.76.1)
full diff: https://github.com/zigpy/zigpy/compare/0.76.0...0.76.1


### Notes about these releases

These releases fix an isssue where v2 quirks that use the zigpy unit enums did not have the correct unit.
(A regression test in zigpy and another one in ZHA is also added/fixed to check for this. Existing tests unfortunately did not catch this before, as they did not use the unit enums from zigpy, like v2 quirks do.)

title: Add DS2450 to onewire integration
body:
<!--
  You are amazing! Thanks for contributing to our project!
  Please, DO NOT DELETE ANY TEXT from this template! (unless instructed).
-->
## Proposed change
  DS2450 is a [1-Wire Quad A/D Converter ](https://www.analog.com/media/en/technical-documentation/data-sheets/ds2450.pdf), which enables ease of integration of various DIY projects esp. when using 1-wire emulation connecting up to four sensors e.g. via I2C to a microcontroller. OWFS has full support for DS2450 so the needed additions for HA are very minor.
This PR adds the needed ADC channel readings from OWFS file structure to HA.
volt.A .. volt.D and latestvolt.A .. latestvolt.D (disabled by default). Latestvolt had been introduced by [QWFS](https://github.com/owfs/owfs/commit/b748d0009fa11e656955cb7525d964847acee212).
The entities created with a name key reflecting the ADC channel rather being enumerated.

body:

<!--

The backup store was changed several times on the dev branch. Users who have been

title: Fix incorrect Bluetooth source address when restoring data from D-Bus
body:
## Proposed change
<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the
  maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug
  or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue in the
  additional information section.
-->
Before we had a way to get the MAC address and used the MAC address for the source address, we used the name of the interface for the source. When restoring data from D-Bus we need to convert the adapter name to the source MAC address so it matches the newly discovered data. This fixes the source being incorrect until a new Advertisement is received. This problem was discovered with the new Advertisement Monitor panel which made the data more visible.

## Type of change
<!--
  What type of change does your PR introduce to Home Assistant?

body:

  You are amazing! Thanks for contributing to our project!

-->

## Proposed change
<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the
  maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug
  or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue in the
  additional information section.

title: Cancel call if user does not pick up
body:
<!--
  You are amazing! Thanks for contributing to our project!
  Please, DO NOT DELETE ANY TEXT from this template! (unless instructed).
-->
## Breaking change
<!--
  If your PR contains a breaking change for existing users, it is important
  to tell them what breaks, how to make it work again and why we did this.
  This piece of text is published with the release notes, so it helps if you
  write it towards our users, not us.
  Note: Remove this section if this PR is NOT a breaking change.

<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the
  maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug
  or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue in the

title: Tweak Matter discovery to ignore empty lists
body:
## Proposed change

While testing some (sample) appliance device types I noticed we're created empty select or sensor enum entities sometimes, because the Matter clusters lib had a default defined for the value while the actual supported list was empty.

This tweaks the discovery logic so we can now also define value checks on the secondary attribute(value) and adjusts all the select and sensor discovery schemas to ignore empty lists.

title: Feature Alert Events
body:
## Proposed change
The Alert integration provides functionality for managing the alert lifecycle (generate, done, reset, acknowledge) and sending notifications when alerts are generated or done. However, there is limited flexibility in managing where the notification get sent. For example, sending notifications to a device based on time of day or device location; or escalating the alert to send to other devices if it repeats more than 3 times.

With this enhancement, Alerts will generate events when the alert lifecycle changes and when alerts are repeated; allowing the user to create automations that listen to the events and perform custom notification routing.

Example event (new functionality)

```
event_type: alert_notify
data:
  entity_id: alert.al_ts_sensor_2_temperature_low
  action: generate
  title: Temperature Cold
  message: ALERT Yo dude its cold!
  repeat: 0
  data:
    title: Cold
    actions:
      - action: ACK_AL_TS_SENSOR_2_TEMPERATURE_LOW
        title: Acknowledge
      - action: NONE
        title: No Action
origin: LOCAL
time_fired: "2025-01-29T15:57:53.699782+00:00"
context:
  id: 01JJSCH1N32R660MEE5471M3EQ
  parent_id: null
  user_id: null

```

Example alert definition (existing functionality)

```
alert:
  al_ts_sensor_2_temperature_low:
    name: ts_sensor_2_temperature_low
    message: 'ALERT Yo dude it's cold'
    done_message: 'Cleared'
    title: Temperature Cold
    entity_id: input_boolean.alert_trigger
    state: "on"
    repeat:
      - 1
      - 1
      - 1
    can_acknowledge: true
    skip_first: false
    data:
      title: Cold
      actions:
        - action: ACK_AL_TS_SENSOR_2_TEMPERATURE_LOW
          title: Acknowledge
        - action: NONE
          title: No Action
```

body:

title: Rename Peblar Uptime sensor to last restart
body:
<!--
  You are amazing! Thanks for contributing to our project!
  Please, DO NOT DELETE ANY TEXT from this template! (unless instructed).
-->
## Proposed change
<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the
  maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug
  or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue in the
  additional information section.
-->
As discussed [here](https://github.com/home-assistant/core/pull/136763#pullrequestreview-2579508545). 'Last restart' is a better name for Uptime for a sensor that provides a timestamp which indicates last (re)start.

Keeping the `key` the same to make it backwards compatible.

title: Fix typing errors in HEOS tests
body:
## Proposed change
<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the
  maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug
  or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue in the
  additional information section.
-->
Introduced a `MockHeos` class to properly type mocked methods and encapsulate/centralize modifying internal data structures in the HEOS API instead of having it littered throughout tests. Most changed lines are updating the type in the test fixtures (`Heos` -> `MockHeos`). Fixed all typing errors found by running `mypy tests/components/heos --strict`. There were a couple of bugs in the tests this revealed, but nothing that ultimately affected the test accuracy. Tests are more tight and correct now.

TLDR: Ran `mypy` against the HEOS tests and fixed the issues. 😆

title: Bump total-connect-client to 2025.1.4
body:
<!--
  You are amazing! Thanks for contributing to our project!
  Please, DO NOT DELETE ANY TEXT from this template! (unless instructed).
-->

## Proposed change
<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the
  maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug
  or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue in the
  additional information section.
-->
Updates total_connect_client to 2025.1.4 which updates certain authentication API calls due to changes on the TotalConnect servers.  Update tests to adjust for new API calls during authentication.

Changelog for all changes since last version used in HA:  https://github.com/craigjmidwinter/total-connect-client/compare/2024.12...2025.1.4

Prior to the authentication problem, we were improving the typing in total_connect_client. We decided that various IDs should be strings, including partition_id.  This is why partition_id changes to a string in alarm_control_panel, tests and snapshot files.
